chat.content:
I will give you a Coq proof state, including both hypotheses and a specific goal and your need to prove it. Your response should be a singular code block of Coq proof starting with "```coq
", ending with "Qed.```", without any additional explanation or commentary. Follow to these guidelines:
Introduce variables using unique names to avoid any conflicts.
Keep each command distinct and separated, avoid concatenations like ';' or '[cmd|cmd]'.
Organize your proof with bullets like '-', '+', and '*' instead of braces ({, }). Shift to their double symbols like '--' and '++', when necessary.
Effectively use given premises, follow the syntax and structure demonstrated in the examples provided.

Example 1:

Hypotheses:
n, m: nat
IHn: m + n = n + m

Goal:
m + S n = S n + m

Proof:
```coq
simpl. rewrite <- IHn. auto.
Qed.```

Example 2:
Hypotheses:

Goal:
forall n m : nat, m + n = n + m

```coq
intros n m. induction n.
- simpl. auto.
- simpl. rewrite <- IHn. auto.
Qed.```

Solve This Proof State:

Hypotheses:


Goal:
TraverseVarInjective

Premises:
Record TraverseVarInjective (V : Type) (H : Var V) (T : Type) (H0 : Traverse V T) : Prop := Build_TraverseVarInjective { traverse_var_injective : forall f : nat -> nat -> nat, (forall x1 x2 l : nat, f l x1 = f l x2 -> x1 = x2) -> forall (t1 t2 : T) (l : nat), traverse_var f l t1 = traverse_var f l t2 -> t1 = t2 } Arguments TraverseVarInjective {V}%type_scope {H} {T}%type_scope {H0} Arguments Build_TraverseVarInjective [V]%type_scope _ [T]%type_scope _ _%function_scope
Build_TraverseVarInjective : forall (V : Type) (H : Var V) (T : Type) (H0 : Traverse V T), (forall f : nat -> nat -> nat, (forall x1 x2 l : nat, f l x1 = f l x2 -> x1 = x2) -> forall (t1 t2 : T) (l : nat), traverse_var f l t1 = traverse_var f l t2 -> t1 = t2) -> TraverseVarInjective
LiftInjective_Traverse = fun (V : Type) (H : Var V) (T : Type) (H0 : Traverse V T) (H1 : TraverseVarInjective) => {| lift_injective := fun (w k : nat) (t1 t2 : T) (H2 : traverse (fun l x : nat => var (lift w (l + k) x)) 0 t1 = traverse (fun l x : nat => var (lift w (l + k) x)) 0 t2) => traverse_var_injective (fun l x : nat => lift w (l + k) x) (fun (x1 x2 l : nat) (H3 : lift w (l + k) x1 = lift w (l + k) x2) => lift_injective w (l + k) x1 x2 H3) t1 t2 0 H2 |} : forall (V : Type) (H : Var V) (T : Type) (H0 : Traverse V T), TraverseVarInject...
ssreflect.abstract_lock = unit : Set
Nat.eq_equiv = RelationClasses.eq_equivalence : RelationClasses.Equivalence eq
Init.Nat.sub = fix sub (n m : nat) {struct n} : nat := match n with | 0 => n | S k => match m with | 0 => n | S l => sub k l end end : nat -> nat -> nat Arguments Init.Nat.sub (_ _)%nat_scope
OrderedRing.sor_setoid_Reflexive : forall (R : Type) (rO rI : R) (rplus rtimes rminus : R -> R -> R) (ropp : R -> R) (req rle rlt : R -> R -> Prop), OrderedRing.SOR rO rI rplus rtimes rminus ropp req rle rlt -> RelationClasses.Reflexive req
BinNat.N.le = fun x y : BinNums.N => BinNat.N.compare x y <> Gt : BinNums.N -> BinNums.N -> Prop Arguments BinNat.N.le (_ _)%N_scope
ssrfun.involutive : forall A : Type, (A -> A) -> Prop
OrderedRing.SORopp_wd : forall (R : Type) (rO rI : R) (rplus rtimes rminus : R -> R -> R) (ropp : R -> R) (req rle rlt : R -> R -> Prop), OrderedRing.SOR rO rI rplus rtimes rminus ropp req rle rlt -> forall x1 x2 : R, req x1 x2 -> req (ropp x1) (ropp x2)
Nat.neq_0_lt_0 : forall n : nat, n <> 0 < -> 0 < n
BinNat.N.le_0_2 = BinNat.N.lt_le_incl BinNums.N0 (BinNums.Npos (BinNums.xO BinNums.xH)) BinNat.N.lt_0_2 : BinNat.N.le BinNums.N0 (BinNums.Npos (BinNums.xO BinNums.xH))
BinNat.N.lt = fun x y : BinNums.N => BinNat.N.compare x y = Lt : BinNums.N -> BinNums.N -> Prop Arguments BinNat.N.lt (_ _)%N_scope
exist : forall (A : Type) (P : A -> Prop) (x : A), P x -> {x : A | P x}
BinNat.N.eqf = fun f g : BinNums.N -> bool => forall n : BinNums.N, f n = g n : (BinNums.N -> bool) -> (BinNums.N -> bool) -> Prop Arguments BinNat.N.eqf (_ _)%function_scope
Eqdep_dec.UIP_refl_nat : forall (n : nat) (x : n = n), x = eq_refl
nat_ind : forall P : nat -> Prop, P 0 -> (forall n : nat, P n -> P (S n)) -> forall n : nat, P n
ARmul_assoc : forall (R : Type) (rO rI : R) (radd rmul rsub : R -> R -> R) (ropp : R -> R) (req : R -> R -> Prop), almost_ring_theory rO rI radd rmul rsub ropp req -> forall x y z : R, req (rmul x (rmul y z)) (rmul (rmul x y) z)
BinInt.Z.opp_le_mono : forall n m : BinNums.Z, BinInt.Z.le n m < -> BinInt.Z.le (BinInt.Z.opp m) (BinInt.Z.opp n)
BinInt.Z.le = fun x y : BinNums.Z => BinInt.Z.compare x y <> Gt : BinNums.Z -> BinNums.Z -> Prop Arguments BinInt.Z.le (_ _)%Z_scope
Qreduction.Qred_complete : forall p q : QArith_base.Q, QArith_base.Qeq p q -> Qreduction.Qred p = Qreduction.Qred q
Tauto.or_cnf : forall Term' Annot : Type, (Term' -> bool) -> (Term' -> Term' -> option Term') -> Tauto.cnf Term' Annot -> Tauto.cnf Term' Annot -> Tauto.cnf Term' Annot
Tauto.cnf = fun Term' Annot : Type => list (Tauto.clause Term' Annot) : Type -> Type -> Type Arguments Tauto.cnf (_ _)%type_scope
BinInt.Z.lt_succ_diag_r : forall n : BinNums.Z, BinInt.Z.lt n (BinInt.Z.succ n)
Inductive Z : Set := Z0 : BinNums.Z | Zpos : BinNums.positive -> BinNums.Z | Zneg : BinNums.positive -> BinNums.Z Arguments BinNums.Zpos _%positive_scope Arguments BinNums.Zneg _%positive_scope
Nat.lt_1_2 = (fun lemma : 2 = 2 => Morphisms.Reflexive_partial_app_morphism (Morphisms.subrelation_proper Nat.lt_wd tt (Morphisms.subrelation_respectful (Morphisms.subrelation_refl eq) (Morphisms.subrelation_respectful (Morphisms.subrelation_refl eq) Morphisms.iff_flip_impl_subrelation))) (Morphisms.reflexive_proper_proxy RelationClasses.Equivalence_Reflexive 1) 2 2 lemma) Nat.two_succ (Nat.lt_succ_diag_r 1) : 1 < 2
Inductive bool : Set := true : bool | false : bool
Nat.mod_wd = PeanoNat.Nat.mod_wd_obligation_1 : Morphisms.Proper (Morphisms.respectful eq (Morphisms.respectful eq eq)) Nat.modulo
BinNat.N.odd_spec : forall n : BinNums.N, BinNat.N.odd n = true < -> BinNat.N.Odd n
